title: Should Medication Be a ‘Last Resort’ in Treating Mental Illness?
sub_head: Thank goodness my doctor didn’t wait until everything else had been tried.
body:
Erica Komisar rightly draws attention to overmedication of patients who present with symptoms of anxiety and depression (“For Mental Illness, Make Pills a Last Resort,” op-ed, April 5). But she questions the validity of these conditions as legitimate brain disorders, overlooking decades of research.
She concludes that medication should be used “for serious clinical conditions, or only after everything else has been tried and failed.” Following this recommendation would place many patients at risk for worsening conditions, unnecessary suffering and, in some cases, increased mortality.
